fields.description: Now that showComments persists with the registered user with 1.1 and greater, it would be nice to have a link near the shown comment box to hide it again and reduce clutter.  I know that I can append '&showComments=false' to the URL, but not all users may be that savvy...
fields.summary: Add "Hide Comments" link when comments are shown

fields.description:
We've got an internal monitoring tool pointed at /homepage.action just so we can be warned if the server happens to go down.  What we saw when we upgraded was a performance difference of about .5 to .6 seconds, see attached.

One major change is that our 1.0.2 instance ran on top of embedded HSQL  while our 1.1.2 installation runs on Oracle.  So, this probably isn't even an apples-apples comparison.

Still, I thought it was interesting enough to pass along as more of an FYI -- feel free to close if it's not worth keeping around on your issue reports.

Sub-1 second page times are still good, mind you!  We tend to view a >50-100 millisecond latency degradation from release to release as noticeable for our own production systems, so that attitude is part of what caused us to notice the change.
fields.summary: Performance degradation for dashboard/homepage.action in 1.1.x?

fields.description:
Currently the title in PDF is displayed using Helvetica font, which is one of the base/standard 14 fonts bundled. This default font can only display a small subset of characters, causing some i18n titles to fail.  

We will use Verdana font for the title for now.

fields.summary: Exporting page with ISO-8859-2 (eg. Hungarian chars) fail

fields.description:
Create a page with some accented characters (in Croatian language - iso-8859-2 - they're e.g. Ccaron, Scaron etc). Everything's fine. Now export that page to PDF. Instead of seeing those accented characters, you'll see little empty squares.

I guess PDF exporter should embed the appropriate fonts into the document.
fields.summary: Exporting accented characters to PDF

fields.description: Enable CamelCase link style and enter e.g. WinCVS or TkCVS. Those words will be parsed as CamelCase, although they're not (e.g. CamelCase words must not have two or more capital letters next to each other; WinCvs is a proper CamelCase word, WinCVS is not).
fields.summary: Non-CamelCase words parsed as CamelCase

fields.description:
Enable CamelCase link style and enter several CamelCase words in a single line, like:

This is a line WithLink, AnotherLink, YetAnotherLink and EvenAnotherLink.

Not all CamelCase words will be parsed as links, but only the odd ones (WithLink, YetAnotherLink).
fields.summary: More than one CamelCase link in a single line

fields.summary: Stack dump on database setup for SunONE

fields.description:
I've created a page "Foo123" containing "foo123 123".
When searching for 123, I get no match. Searching for "foo123" returns the page. So I can not search for numbers.
I've looked in the lucene FAQ but did not find an obvious answer for this.
fields.summary: Search of numbers yiels no result

fields.description:
Currently the daily backup files are named

daily-backup-04Jun2004.zip


If they were named something like

2004-06-04-daily-backup.zip

Then they would be easier to manage on the file system - would list nicely in order, can wildcard delete etc.
fields.summary: Change backup filenames to 2004-06-29 format

fields.description:
When attempting to add files as attachments to pages the action fails.

In some cases, the attachment is successful, but the result page is a single text string saying "The parameter is invalid."  Going back to the page shows the attachment was successfully uploaded and attached.

In many cases, however, the attachment fails (sometimes on the same file) and the result page is the Attach File page with a red bar over the File name box saying "You must enter a file to upload"... which I already did, along with a comment ...

The size is set at 10MB, and the file is only 52KB.  It is regularly reproducable but doesn't seem to have a discernable pattern -- sometimes I can attach files and it succeeds and then when I try to attach another it fails.  

This is getting really frustrating for my users.
fields.summary: Attachments seem to randomly fail

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-1475]. {panel} The templates need a way to specify the size of the editbox that's created. I wanted to create a page layour template for defining our plugin help pages, to sort-of specify what type of information is expected... but one section that's needed is the whole "description" of the plugin, which is at least a paragraph, and another needs to be a sentence or two for "each" settings. Working in the little boxes we're given now is so uncomfortable that noone will actually use them... And for our settings, it would be *awesome* to be able to specify, in the template, that a certain section should be repeated one or more times, so I could define something like:
Setting Name
Setting Description [Optionally, setting values:
  • value
  • value
  • value
]
And have the whole section, and internally, the 'value' section, repeated as often as necessary for any given plugin.
fields.summary: Template "space" is too small

fields.description: There needs to be a way to link to some of the "special" pages from the wiki and the blogs.  For instance: the "Orphaned Pages" page and the "Undefined Pages."   My suggestion would be that they be treated as virtual pages, so someone can just like to them like [Orphaned Pages] or [sectionkey:Oprhaned Pages]
fields.summary: Link to "special" pages

fields.description:
So, at this point, it seems that to change the CSS I have to manually create a whole template just so I can point the CSS at a custom sheet that I designed myself...  That's a bit ridiculous.

I mean, I can understand wanting to keep things relatively similar so that users of Confluence will recognize other confluence Wiki's on site, but you have to understand that if someone's going to use Confluence as their main documentation, it needs to blend into their main site at least in part, and we can't make this blend by just tweaking the colors of the header.

I'd recomend putting the CSS in the template editing page or something, so that a user can easily tweak _just_ the CSS, without messing up anything else.
fields.summary: It's too hard to tweak the CSS

fields.description:
Our repository seems to be corrupted. We can't reproduce the bug, but see attached screenshot for corrupted data.

The same page appears several times on "Recently Updated" -list and several times on the "Children"-list of it's parent. Yet, when one goes to the page, "Page Not Found" is displayed. If we link the page from another, we can get to the create page and are able to create yet another row to database, but the problem persists.

Is it safe to say "delete from content where title = 'Testing Tips' and spaceid = 13" to clear the repository? Should Confluence be restarted if we do this?
fields.summary: Repository corruption

So search of non-ascii characters seems to be messed up.

    '--stdout --disable-summary -r {}', [0], [1],
    qr/^.*?: (?!Infected Archive)(.*) FOUND$/ ],

    '-i1 -xp {}', [0,10,15], [5,20,21,25],
    qr/(?:CURED|INFECTED|CUREFAILED|WARNING|SUSPICION) (.*)/ ,
    sub {chdir('/opt/kav/bin') or die "Can't chdir to kav: $!"},

fields.description:
When exporting PDF's, the icons generated by (x) and (/) etc aren't exported.

I'm creating this as a separate issue since the original report about this (CONF-783) had two separate issues in one report. I suggest you change the description of the original issue to only contain exporting of attached images. Or have I understood wrong and is the other issue about images not working at all at some point?

We're using Confluence for various task lists where task status is marked with the symbols. Exporting pages to PDF is a very handy way of distributing the pages in a non-editable manner but since the icons aren't exported, the feature is next to useless and as I stated in a comment to the other issue, this is our current pet peeve in Confluence. ;)
fields.summary: Icons don't get exported in PDFs

fields.description:
If you are part of the confluence-administrators group by default you can see all spaces and content.  

This breaks the space permissions if you just add specific users that are not part of the confluence-administrators group.

In our case, we have administrators that should be able to administer certain spaces, and also manage users and groups.  However, we have a space that we don't want these people to see or administer.

Right now we can specify certain users to see and administer the space, but then any administrator can just come in and do things to this space.

We require that the space honours the space assigned privileges only.
fields.summary: confluence-administrators should not have access to all content

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-1436].
  {panel}

We have a large amount of content that we would like to put into Confluence, but we are worried about the amount of space it will take and the additional size of the backups.

If we could store the files in a directory that:
a) Confluence can see locally (maybe within the confluence directories)
b) Can be accessed via a URL (maybe manual setup within Tomcat)

If the indexer could also look at these directories we can find these URLs easily.

If you could even index external sites that might be useful (although potentially time and space consuming).
fields.summary: Allow indexing of content outside of Confluence

fields.description:
In Jira, attachments are not part of the backup, and need to be backed up separately.  I can see how a lot of people would like how Confluence puts it all into one file.

In our case, however, we will have a large number of attachments and hence the single backup file is very large.

In our case, we use a tool called HandyBackup which can synchronise a directory tree.  With Jira since most attachments rarely change the back is small and fast on a daily basis.  With Confluence, we have to backup one large file every day.

If the system could allow you to specify whether the attachments are included in the backup or not that would be helpful.
fields.summary: Allow attachments to be backed up separately

fields.summary: System Error when opening child page

fields.description:
Here's the sequence to get this re-create this problem.
1) install orion server
2) get release 1 jdbc drivers from microsoft
3) install confluence under orion
4) define data-sources in orion
5) create empty db in ms sql server
6) startup orion, setup confluence to point to new empty db
7) login to confluence after setup, create 1 space
8) exit confluence, shutdown orion and restart
9) try to access confluence and get this error:

org.springframework.jdbc.UncategorizedSQLException: (HibernateAccessor): encountered SQLException [[Microsoft][SQLServer 2000 Driver for JDBC]ResultSet can not re-read row data for column 2.]; nested exception is java.sql.SQLException: [Microsoft][SQLServer 2000 Driver for JDBC]ResultSet can not re-read row data for column 2. 

From microsoft, the problem is the following:
For nvarchar,image,text types the driver throws exception when the order you retrieved is differ from the order you access the result

There are three tables in confluence with type 'Text' - CONTENT, EMAILTEMPLATES, and PAGETEMPLATES. I'm guessing the problem is with one of these tables. Here is more of the server log error:

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-1422].
  {panel}

Currently there are only the following decorators available:

* Site Decorators
** Main
** Popup
** Printable
* Export Templates
** Space
** Page
* Content Templates
** Blog Post
** Listed Blog Post

It would be *really* useful if we could add to those lists, eg: a customA below printable and using a url like in the print button to change to it. At the moment 3 decorators for normal page displaying is too restrictive.
fields.summary: Custom / Additional Decorators
Separate the administrator priveleges from contact Administrator list

Workaround: Insert the first entry twice.
fields.summary: jiraissues macro ignores the first entry in the colums parameter

fields.description:
We have separate space for each project in our company's internal Confluence. Since I'm administrating Confluence, all spaces are shown on my Dashboard.

The problem is that the Dashboard becomes almost unusable for me, because whereas other people have 5 spaces visible, I have 12 spaces already, most of which do not interest me at all. And we have just started to use Confluence: I expect the problem to become worse in the future.

So my kind wish is to be able to filter spaces which are visible for me. This should affect both the list of spaces and the list of recently updated pages.
fields.summary: Allow user to filter spaces visible to him

fields.description:
We've set up a few new issue types and added icons to these. The icons for the "standard" Jira issues work without problems but the icons for the new issue types only print the following as the image URL within the img tag:

$icons.get( $item.getElementValue('type') )

So apparently Confluence or Jira isn't evaluating something. This isn't critical but makes for ugly printouts from the macro due to lots of broken images if the issue type is shown.
fields.summary: jiraissues macro custom icons break
a true inheritance from templates

fields.description:
A JIRA like permissions scheme should be used to define permissions.
A permission scheme could then be attached to spaces.

All confluence actions should be available in a permissions scheme :
- All page operations
- browse incoming links
- browse trackback links
- browse hot referrers
- browse external references
- add blog
- modify blog
- delete blog
- add comment
- view comment
- delete comment
- administrate space
- use notation

Maybe other actions should be added
fields.summary: a JIRA like permissions scheme showing all confluence actions
Hierarchical spaces

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-1406].
  {panel}

I'd like to tag page versions using a verbose tag, like tagging files in CVS.

The following operations should be possible:

1) Tag one page with a new tag -> marks the current revision with the tag
2) Move an existing tag to the latest version
3) Tag multiple pages with a tag, with the option to move existing tag

Then make it possible to export pages based on the tags on the page versions and some mechanism which would ease finding a set of document versions with a certain tag.
fields.summary: Page and space version tagging

fields.description:
In a configuration with Confluence 1.0 + JIRA 2.6.1 + JRA-3913 patch, the {jiraissues} macro prints created/update/due dates as "Wed, 7 Apr 2004 00:00:00 +0300 (EEST)" instead of the documented "07/Apr/2004" or the Confluence general config's format (copied below). This causes the lists to be very wide with most space wasted by the unnecessary time information.

Formatting
Encoding: 	UTF-8
Time Format:	HH:mm:ss (14:49:36)
Date Time Format:	MMM dd, yyyy HH:mm (Jun 17, 2004 14:49)
Date Format:	MMM dd, yyyy (Jun 17, 2004)
Long Number Format: 	###############
Decimal Number Format: 	###############.##########
fields.summary: Date formats of jiraissues macro

fields.description:
When a space is exported but only a subset of the pages is chosen to be exported, the document tree of the exported PDF still contains all page titles in the space.

This causes generating small multi-page PDF's to require a separate space for each document since otherwise the document will contain unwanted information about other pages in the same space. In my understanding the correct behavior would be to only contain the pages which are being exported in the document tree.

I know the logic for parsing the tree to only include the exported pages in a way that makes sense is very hairy so I'll try my best at later posting a comment with proposal for the logic. ;)

fields.description:
A more powerful table layout would greatly benefit the use of Confluence as CMS. 

Specifcially the following features would help greatly:
- Set the column width in % of table width 
- Set the table width manually 
- Set cell height specifically 
- Center the table 
- Not to display the lines around the table (tracked as CONF-5310)

Please see http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DISC/TableImprovement
fields.summary: Support for editing width/height/alignment of tables, rows and columns

fields.description:
The {children} macro is useful for easily keeping document trees up to date for a document.  I like that there is one less thing to update when adding new pages.

As you may be aware Bob McWhirter has developed a script in Perl that generates an HTML site from documents in Confluence through the API.  Codehaus is using this with great success.

One of the things that he's done is specify that pages named with certain key words will be generated into special locations on the html.  For instance, a file in Confluence named 'Navigation' will be used for the left nav bar.  In this case, it would be great to be able to use the {children} macro, but the current page is always 'Navigation' and has no children.

What I'm proposing is that the children macro takes an argument of the page that the children should be generated from.  Once that's done, several {children} macros in a row with different section roots could be used to maintain a dynamic nav bar on the site.

For a good example of this when it is generated by hand, check out http://despots.codehaus.org/Confluenza.
fields.summary: Upgrade {children} macro to optionally specify a page

fields.description:
I am having the following problem.  All non-tip versions of the attachments do not include the web app context/virtual root.  In our installation we have installed Confluence into TomCat 5.0.25 under a "Confluence" context.  This problem prevents users from accessing older versions of the attachments via the URL given by confluence on the history expansion for an attachment.  The older version of the attachment is available as long as the URL is properly typed in.

For example:

Tip URL: http://169.172.211.156:8080/confluence/download/attachments/12/BUG.jpg?version=2

Non-Tip URL:
http://169.172.211.156:8080/download/attachments/12/BUG.jpg?version=1

Notice the Non-Tip URL is missing the "Confluence" context.
fields.summary: URL for the non-tip version of an attachment is incorrect
